primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of a failed disciple (Peter) through the love of Christ, which then empowers the disciple to serve others.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus faces him and asks him one question
Jesus said, 'I've got something for you to do'
He'll give you what to say, and he'll teach you how to say it
give them a sense of restoration and of reconciliation
the key that will unlock the door
The Lord will make a way
He merely asked him, 'Do you love me? I can fix everything right'
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver (the one needing the way made).

helper.identificatie: Love (as a divine/human bridge) and Mothers
tekstueel_bewijs: the fire of love will do something
mothers peer through all that's wrong and ugly and find what is decent
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the 'Who' when the 'How' is missing.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The Lord making a way).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin/Failure and Life's Storms (Depression, Poverty, Despair)
tekstueel_bewijs: the chill of the night that somehow unhitched him
the storms and stresses of adolescence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'the world' that holds mistakes against people and the 'bitterness of despair' that makes one feel like an orphan.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical mandate to feed the sheep and care for the neighbor's physical needs.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The neighbor's welfare (Food, clothing, shelter, spiritual comfort)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that the 'How' (feeding sheep) is impossible without the 'Who' (Love for/from Christ).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus faces him and asks him one question.
The Lord will make a way.
He'll give you what to say.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have the notion that somewhere... there is a key.
You and I ought to be very careful.
You don't give up anywhere else.

voorbeelden: You and I ought to be very careful about making comparisons.
I don't know what they fit.
The Lord will make a way.
He'll teach you how to say it.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Who' (Divine Power/Pouvoir) over the 'How' (Human Knowledge/Savoir). It moves from human inability to divine capability.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (the world holding mistakes against us) to ~S2 (the mother/Jesus looking past the mistake) to S1 (the restoration of love).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by shifting the focus from the 'How' (mechanics of survival) to the 'Who' (the person of Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon acknowledges the 'world collapsed' and the 'bitterness of despair'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses 'Love' as a central theme, it defines this love as Christ's initiative to restore a denier, rather than a human work to earn God's favor.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: at least you ought to be honest about it. Your love for the Lord has cooled off.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I can fix everything right if you care about me.
She didn't know how, but she knew who.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mothers are used as an analogy for God's grace—seeing the 'good' in a child when the world sees the 'bad'.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Peter (as a model of one who is restored, not one who succeeds by effort)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by focusing on Jesus' questioning of Peter rather than Peter's effort to return.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; shifting the burden of 'making a way' from the self to the Lord.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration: God initiates the 'way' when human resources are exhausted.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the biblical narrative of Peter to the personal narrative of the preacher's mother is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Love' as a feeling/requirement and 'Love' as a gift/empowerment.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: If you love me... I can fix everything right.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Lord 'gives words' and 'teaches how', implying an external endowment of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; sin is seen as a 'denial' that requires a three-fold restoration.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the Subject of the 'way-making' and the hearer as the receiver of grace.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel judged by the 'chilled love' section.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Identify more with Peter's 'grief' and Jesus' 'feeding' before the 'asking'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Jesus fed Peter *before* asking for his love.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current balance; it serves the 'Who over How' theme well.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the 'Who' to the Holy Spirit's indwelling.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Depression/The World) is sufficiently heavy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (The Lord makes a way) → Ethics (Feed my sheep).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of grace-oriented preaching that uses personal narrative to reinforce the actantial role of God as the one who provides the 'Who' when the 'How' is lost.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Key' metaphor; Greimas shows that the 'Key' is actually a Subject-switch from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek words for love (agape/phileo); Greimas focuses on the functional role of love as a 'Helper' for the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Mother' figure functions as a 'Helper' that mirrors the 'Sender' (God), creating a powerful emotional resonance.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Lord (makes a way, picks up, comforts)
The World (looks for what's wrong, holds mistakes)
appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of the 'Christus Victor' over despair and the 'Participation' model of grace.
